review_title: A progressive, forward-thinking and inclusive company
pros: A brilliant company to work for which values its staff, equipping them with the knowledge, support and resources to progress their own careers. Good pay, great holiday allowance and flexible working. Colleagues across the Group are experienced, dedicated and a joy to work with.
cons: Whilst working from home allows the flexibility so many of us need to balance our work and homes lives, working remotely can be a little lonely at times.

pros: I started here in February and as with every change in job, there is always the element of the unknown. But CPL Group have been a fabulous company to come on board with. The expertise across the group is great and everyone is more than willing to help each other out. There is a great comradery across the staff at all levels and everyone feels included. There is a real sense of family and you know that all employees are there for the same goal. Highly recommend working here
cons: There are no downsides to working here

pros: Fantastic culture, puts colleagues at the heart of everything they do.
cons: There isn't any, a business making a real difference to the education sector

review_title: The best company I have worked for in my whole career
job_title: Senior Procurement Consultant in Newcastle upon Tyne, England
pros: The way CPL manage their staff is like a family member: with respect, with care, and with consideration. The business activity is conducted diligently and professionally, with serious attention to any reactive matters.
cons: If I find any, I'm comfortable in the company resolving them in the way I have come to expect them too.

job_title: Senior Procurement Consultant in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros:
Helpful and friendly colleagues.
Approachable senior management team.
Opportunities for internal progression.
Flexible culture with agile and home working available.
Varied and interesting work.
Plenty of training opportunities.
cons: Although internal progression is good, would be nice to have a clearer picture mapped out for all staff. May motivate staff more to progress within the company.

pros: Fantastic culture, great people, diversity, management that care about their employees, lovely offices, forward thinking, will develop you.
cons: As a small business, opportunities to progress are possibly more limited than in some larger businesses,.

job_title: Regional Procurement Manager in Salford, North West England, England
pros: Fabulous bunch of people to work with, good pay rates, good holiday allowance, flexible working. Professional procurement at it's best!

Supportive, 
Professional, 
Non Judgemental,
Teamwork ethic,
Trusting,
Caring.
cons: Can feel a little remote and isolating at times

job_title: Category Manager in Salford, North West England, England
pros: great team, good support from management, learning opportunities and CPD provided as well as opportunities for internal promotion.
cons: I have not found any draw back yet since starting 15 months ago.

review_title: I wouldn't want to work anywhere else
pros: The team. The workplace. The charity work.
cons: I cannot think of any cons for the Group.

review_title: Best company I have ever worked for
pros: Supportive management, great colleagues, nice people
cons: No real downsides to working for this company

review_title: A great company to work for.
job_title: Human Resources Advisor in Salford, North West England, England
pros: Agile / flexible working, suits around my childcare duties
cons: Improvement in communication from management required.
